pr_title: [BUILD] Move PR labeler to GitHub action

timeline.message: Copy over tested labeler configuration from my forked repo
Remove the no longer used autolabeler
Clean up a few of the labels

timeline.bodyText: This indicates we want it to run whenever the files change, so that the labels are up to date with what is touched.
timeline.author: kbendick
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+name: "Pull Request Labeler"
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  triage:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+    - uses: actions/labeler@v2
+      with:
+        repo-token: "${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
+        sync-labels: true

timeline.bodyText: If the apache github organization has enabled Github Actions for all of the repos, this should just work. If not, I'll need to reach out to the ASF Infra team to have them enable github actions for this repo.

replies.bodyText: It feels like there should be a way to say "All top level folders are modules and label accordingly" but If there isn't I think this is 👍
replies.author: RussellSpitzer

replies.bodyText:
Yeah there's not unfortunately. In fact, their docs said if we wanted a top level folder named foo, its contents, and all of its subdirectories contents to be labeled, we should have to do the following two line S3 permissions inspired monstrosity (though I tested it and that's not the case):
FOO:
  - foo/*
  - foo/**/*
replies.author: kbendick
